TopicTitle: Outer planets mod crash the game

Articles.Content:
I am craving new bodies to visit, and i decided to mod my game and install Outer Planets Mod, since it looks like the perfect mod and should already be included as stock imo.

I already have a few mods installed and it appears that some of my mods is making OPM crash, but i dont know which mod is causing the problems. The mods i have installed at the moment are the following: (i'm not sure what all of these mods do, since some of them are included as packs for other mods i have installed)

Astronomers Visual Pack

CrossFeed Enabler

DDSLoader (dont know what is)

Dmagic Orbital Science

Kerbal Engineer Redux

HullCam

Kopernicus

Munar Surface Experiment

Near Future Electrical and Propulsion

Outer Planet mods

Planetshine

Procedural Fairings

Texture Replacer

Trajectories

I don't know why any of these would cause problems with OPM, and i hope i dont have to remove any of the mods to get OPM working. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

Any help is appreciated ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

You are probably running out of RAM. KSP 32-bit can only use 3.8 GB of RAM. Astronomers Visual Pack and Outer Planets Mod are very RAM intensive. Also, DDSLoader allows KSP to load Direct Draw Surface (.dds) textures.

Running out of ram was a good approach. I saw the ram approached 3.5gb before it crashed so i removed Astronomers visual pack completly and ram went down to 2.4gb but the game still crashed. The newest version of OPM comes with not only one, but plenty of folders i dont know if i even need, like Custom Astroids, Kittopa Space and Nereid.

All my mods are up to date, and ive tried reinstalling the game, but it still crashes when i launch the game.

Would you mind uploading your output\_log and error.log files to a site such as Mediafire or Dropbox, then providing us with a link? It would be really helpful to find the cause of your problem.

All the best.
Those folders are files it needs to work properly. make sure you install all of them properly.
